availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Evans Arthur (Covington, Kentucky, Commonwealth attorney & attorney)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, commonwealth's attorney. Cincinnati, Ohio, native. Son of William Arthur and Eliza Parsons Arthur. Married to Adeliza “Ada” Southgate Arthur in 1855. Father of W. E. Arthur, Jr. Married to Ethalinda Southgate Arthur in 1861. Father of Sidney Arthur and Ada Arthur. Studied law under John White Stevenson and James T. Morehead. Admitted to the bar in 1850. Attorney in Covington in 1850. Commonwealth's attorney for the ninth judicial district of Kentucky from 1856 to 1862. Employed Sarah Gibbers and Mary Kirk as servants in Covington in 1860. Presidential elector on the Democratic ticket of Breckinridge and Lane in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 263A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 700.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 257A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058: Kenton County Births, p. 35.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll 7012984: Covington Deaths, Certificates 1-723 (1897), File 233.
"William Evans Arthur (1825-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial 7092733, accessed April 2, 2020, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7092733/william-evans-arthur.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861,” in 1862 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 303-308.
Paul L. Whalen, "Arthur, William Evans" in The Encyclopedia of Northern Kentucky, Paul A. Tenkotte and James C. Claypool, eds. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2009), 39.
